se.jguru.nazgul.core.osgi.launcher.api

Class AbstractFrameworkLauncher<T extends OsgiFrameworkListener>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.clustering.api.AbstractClusterable
      • se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.event.api.producer.AbstractEventProducer<T>
        • se.jguru.nazgul.core.osgi.launcher.api.AbstractFrameworkLauncher<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, EventConsumerWrapper<T>, EventProducer<T>, se.jguru.nazgul.core.clustering.api.Clusterable, FrameworkLauncher

    public abstract class AbstractFrameworkLauncher<T extends OsgiFrameworkListener>
extends AbstractEventProducer<T>
implements FrameworkLauncher
    Abstract implementation of the FrameworkLauncher interface, which caters for registering and deregistering EventConsumers (in the form of OsgiFrameworkListener instances) to OSGi ServiceEvents.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractFrameworkLauncher

        protected AbstractFrameworkLauncher(se.jguru.nazgul.core.clustering.api.IdGenerator idGenerator,
                                    Class<T> eventConsumerClass)
        Creates a new AbstractFrameworkLauncher with the provided IdGenerator.
        Parameters:
        idGenerator - The ID generator used to acquire a cluster-unique identifier for this AbstractFrameworkLauncher instance.
        eventConsumerClass - The type of eventConsumer which should be used by this AbstractFrameworkLauncher.
        See Also:
        AbstractEventProducer.AbstractEventProducer(IdGenerator, Class)

      • AbstractFrameworkLauncher

        protected AbstractFrameworkLauncher(String clusterUniqueID,
                                    Class<T> eventConsumerClass)
        Creates a new AbstractFrameworkLauncher and assigns the provided cluster-unique ID to this instance.
        Parameters:
        clusterUniqueID - A cluster-unique Identifier.
        eventConsumerClass - The type of eventConsumer which should be used by this AbstractFrameworkLauncher.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Map<String,String> configuration)
                throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes this launcher using the provided configuration map.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface FrameworkLauncher
        Parameters:
        configuration - A Map holding configuration data for the underlying OSGi container.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the container was already started; initializing a running container yields undefined results.

      • createFramework

        protected abstract org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework createFramework(Map<String,String> configuration)
                                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates the OSGi Framework instance from the data within the provided configuration.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The configuration properties given at initialization time to this ContainerEmbedder.
        Returns:
        The initialized - but not started - OSGi Framework reference.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the configuration was deemed inappropriate for initializing the underlying container.

      • start

        public final void start()
                 throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException,
                        IllegalStateException
        Starts the embedded OSGi container. Delegates processing to the onStart method.
        Specified by:
        start in interface FrameworkLauncher
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the container could not be started.
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying OSGi framework was not created/initialized.

      • onInitialize

        protected void onInitialize(Map<String,String> configuration,
                            org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework framework)
        Custom handler for the init event - override this method if you need to implement some custom logic to execute after the Framework is initialized.
        Parameters:
        framework - The just initialized osgiFramework instance.
        configuration - A Map holding configuration data for the underlying OSGi container.

      • onStart

        protected void onStart(org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework framework)
        Custom handler for the start event - override this method if you need to implement some custom logic when the Framework is started.
        Parameters:
        framework - The just started osgiFramework instance.

      • getFramework

        public final org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework getFramework()
        Acquires the OSGi framework from the underlying container.
        Specified by:
        getFramework in interface FrameworkLauncher
        Returns:
        The Framework of the running Container, or null if the Framework was not created (i.e. the FrameworkFactory was not run yet).

      • stop

        public final void stop()
                throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException,
                       IllegalStateException
        Stops the embedded OSGi container. Delegates processing to the onStop method.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface FrameworkLauncher
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the container could not be stopped.
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying OSGi framework was not created/initialized.
